question_bank.diffident: He was so _____ that he avoided speaking unless he was directly asked.
question_bank.prophetic: Her ____ warning about the housing bubble sounded exaggerated at the time but later proved accurate.
question_bank.conformity: The strict dress code was intended to enforce _____ among employees.
question_bank.distribution: The paper reports the income _____ of the sample, not just the average.
question_bank.authoritative: For clinical decisions, rely on an _____ guideline rather than an anonymous forum post.
question_bank.conformist: As a committed _____, he followed group norms even when they conflicted with his private views.
question_bank.collaborating: The two hospitals are _____ on a multicenter trial with a shared protocol.
question_bank.debilitate: Untreated malnutrition can _____ patients and make infections harder to fight.
question_bank.contentious: The proposal was _____, splitting the committee into opposing camps.
question_bank.reticent: During cross-examination, the witness remained _____ and gave only short answers.
question_bank.authoritarian: Under an _____ government, newspapers were censored and political opponents were imprisoned.
question_bank.truism: Saying “change is inevitable” is a _____ that offers little practical guidance.
question_bank.prudence: Simple _____ suggests reading the full contract before signing.
question_bank.astounded: The audience was _____ when the amateur singer delivered a flawless performance.
question_bank.munificent: A _____ benefactor donated enough to fund the entire library renovation.
question_bank.moderate: A neutral judge was appointed to _____ the debate and enforce time limits.
question_bank.mitigate: Wearing protective eyewear can _____ the risk of injury in the lab.
question_bank.callow: His _____ remarks revealed inexperience and poor judgment.
question_bank.duplicitous: The _____ manager promised promotions he never intended to grant.
question_bank.conducive: A quiet room is _____ to concentration during exams.
question_bank.notorious: The restaurant is _____ for its hour-long lines and strict no-substitution policy.
question_bank.astute: An _____ analyst noticed the anomaly in the data before anyone else did.
question_bank.versatile: This _____ tool can tighten screws, cut wire, and open bottles.
question_bank.derivative: Reviewers dismissed the novel as _____, noting that its plot closely copied earlier works.
question_bank.assumptive: Her _____ tone—treating the rumor as fact—undermined her credibility.
